definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge

sentences.english: At that time his both legs were unable to walk normally, speak some enunciations not to be unclear.
sentences.chinese: 当时他的双腿就无法正常行走，说话有些口齿不清。

sentences.english: Whilst starting to learn lisp, I've come across the term tail-recursive.
sentences.chinese: 虽然开始学习口齿不清，我遇到这个词的尾递归的。
那孩子口齿不清地祷告。
她口齿不清地做了一个回答。

sentences.english: The little boy lisped out his story.
sentences.chinese: 小男孩口齿不清地讲了他的故事。

sentences.english: Leave an inarticulate, angry comment below.
sentences.chinese: 留下一段口齿不清的，怒火中烧的评论吧。

sentences.english: The pupil lisped out the answer.
sentences.chinese: 小学生口齿不清地说出答案。

sentences.english: In other words, shaking their hips, and lisping.
sentences.chinese: 换言之，摇动臀部，口齿不清。

sentences.english: Inarticulate beasts is what I would term such people.
sentences.chinese: 口齿不清的野兽是我长期这样的人。

sentences.english: Finally, there is the much-misdescribed "gay lisp".
sentences.chinese: 最后，就是这个经常被误解的“同志型口齿不清”。

definition: incoherent speech/to talk without rhyme or reason (idiom)
mouth and teeth/enunciation/to articulate/diction/age (of cattle, horses etc)
(idiom) to sidestep the question/to answer evasively
to be delirious/to be mentally confused
diction/enunciation/to pronounce the words correctly (in opera)
to hem and haw/to stall/to stammer/to mumble/to falter
to mumble in whispers/to mutter to oneself
